intro: Micropholis madeirensis, commonly known as the Madeira micropholis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the island of Madeira, where it grows in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
